description:
In Dominican Republic in March 17 new measures regarding closure of schools were taken.Teaching was suspended in all schools and universities. In August 24 a new school reopening protocol will start. 
Some measures:
- The seats a meter and a half to its four sides separation
- Constant use of masks
- Distance between students in the hallway
- Restriction of external visits
- Registration of the temperature at the entrance, hand washing with soap and disinfection with hand sanitazer.
-Avoiding handshakes, hugs and the formation of groups to talk, entertain or play.
- The doors and windows of the classrooms must remain open during the school day so that the air inside can flow.
(Among other measures)
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities closed/locked down

description: Dominican Republic set originally a curfew nation wide but it has been relaxed excluding people who work in food, energy and water industry, ports and airports after March 23

The Dominican Republic "announced a curfew expansion from 5 p.m. to 6 a.m. The prior curfew, announced on March 20 by President Danilo Medina, decreed a nationwide curfew between the hours of 8 p.m. and 6 a.m. until April 3" after Mar. 26

description: "The Dominican Government announced a national state of emergency for a period of 25 days" after Mar. 17

The Dominican Republic " extended the nationwide state of emergency that was set to expire that day for 17 more days. The new decree, which will go into effect April 14, extends the national state of emergency Medina previously declared on March 17 and that went into effect on March 19 for a period of 25 days. Under the state of emergency, the country’s borders will remain closed, all incoming flights will be canceled, and most commercial activities and cultural activities will continue to be suspended. Grocery stores, gas stations, pharmacies, and markets will remain open." after April 13

The original state of emergency was set nationwide in March 19 to last until April 12. In April 13, it was extended again till April 30. In April 30 the state of emergency has been extended again till May 18.

In Dominican Republic, the state of emergency has been declared again. From the 20 of July during 45 days (3rd of september)
The presidential provision, after authorization by the National Congress, establishes proportional and temporary restrictions on freedom of movement, association and assembly in accordance with the provisions of literals h) and J) of numeral 6 of article 266 of the Constitution and numerals 8 and 10 of article 11 of Law number. 21-18.
The state of emergency was set to last until September 3 but it has been extended 45 more days. It will last till october 17.

description:
In Dominican Republic, on July 15 new monitoring measures have been deveopled. 

COVID- RD's contact tracing application is made available to the public.
Among other features, this application allows:
- Report symptoms to the General Directorate of Epidemiology to receive follow-up and medical guidance
- Through Contact Tracing, receive notifications if you have had contact with an infected person.
- Locate the closest COVID-19 enabled hospitals and laboratories on the map.
- Access the bulletins and statistics of the Ministry of Public Health
- Access the communications and recommendations of the High Level Commission for the Prevention and Control of Coronavirus.
- Access the Aurora chatbot, from the Ministry of Health.
- Receive notifications about the issuance of new bulletins or official communications.
- In the case of the user being a positive COVID-19 person, receive notification of the “epidemiological discharge” and the “serological discharge” as well as follow-up on their symptoms and mental health advice to help them overcome the disease.
The Dominican Republic created a training programme for health personnel from public health centres on detecting early symptoms of the novel coronavirus.
The Dominican Republic created a training programme for health personnel from public health centres on detecting early symptoms of the novel coronavirus.

description: The Dominican Republic purchased 2 million tablets of "hydroxyclohoroquine (plaquinol)... ensuring treatment for 100,000 people" on March 27.

The Dominican Republic will give in April and May a special monetary incentive of 5000 Dominican pesos (around €76) for the personnel of the Public Health Ministry, National Health Service, PromeseCal (Essential Medicines Programme and Logistic Support Central), 911 System, Armed Forces, National Policies and the National Emergencies Centre (COE).

The Dominican Republic will give in April and May a special monetary incentive of 5000 Dominican pesos (around €76) for the personnel of the Public Health Ministry, National Health Service, PromeseCal (Essential Medicines Programme and Logistic Support Central), 911 System, Armed Forces, National Policies and the National Emergencies Centre (COE).

The Dominican Republic will give in April and May a special monetary incentive of 5000 Dominican pesos (around €76) for the personnel of the Public Health Ministry, National Health Service, PromeseCal (Essential Medicines Programme and Logistic Support Central), 911 System, Armed Forces, National Policies and the National Emergencies Centre (COE).

The Dominican Republic will improve the payment of infectious medicine, internists, pulmonologists and intensivists doctors, as a result of an agreement between the Superintendency of Health and Labour Risks (Sisalril), the ARS (insurance) and the Association of Private Clinics. The raise is from 800 to 2000 Dominican pesos (from €12 to €30,5) per patient and per day. For doctors of other specialties, the raise is from 800 to 1500 Dominican pesos (around €23). This is in effect from 1st April and for 90 days.
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Dominican Republic will give in April and May a special monetary incentive of 10000 Dominican pesos (around €152) for the doctors and high-rank officials of the Armed Forces and the National Police.

On April 2 in the Dominican Republic, "the sum of US $ 2,130,000 is channeled through the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) to dedicate it to... preventing and delaying the spread of the virus in the country. With this fund, care is being optimized for all patients, especially those in critical condition... In addition to that amount, US $ 360,000 has been allocated to strengthen epidemiological surveillance and expand the capacity of the National Laboratory."

On April 2 in the Dominican Republic, "the sum of US $ 2,130,000 is channeled through the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) to dedicate it to... preventing and delaying the spread of the virus in the country. With this fund, care is being optimized for all patients, especially those in critical condition... In addition to that amount, US $ 360,000 has been allocated to strengthen epidemiological surveillance and expand the capacity of the National Laboratory."

In Dominican Republic, on April 3, Hydroxychloroquine treatments are started to be administered free of charge to all patients diagnosed with coronavirus, regardless of whether they are admitted to public or private centers or comply with home isolation.

In Dominican Republic on April 5. An agreement enters into force between the Association of Private Clinics (ANDECLIP), the Dominican Association of ARS (ADARS), the Association of Medical Igualas and ARS (ADIMARS) and SENASA so that the affiliates of the National Health Insurance of the Plans Special Pensioners and Complementary and Voluntary Health Plans diagnosed with COVID-19 are attended in private health facilities at no additional cost. The ARS (risk health managers) will voluntarily assume these copays.

In Dominican Reoublic in April 16, new measures regarding health resources were taken in the strengthening of the National Laboratory by placing purchase orders for 300 kits of 192 tests each (57,600 tests) to be used in the COBAS 6800 that would allow 1,000 daily tests to be carried out. With the support of the private sector, 150 kits of 192 tests (38,800 tests) will also be obtained.

In Dominican Republic in April 17 new measures related to health resources were taken. There have been the new acquisition of 50,000 IgG IgM rapid serological tests, these being among the best on the international market today

Dominican Republic in April 19 new measures regarding health resources were taken. Acquisition of 50 thousand cartridges to be used in the 22 GeneXpert machines that exist in the country, which allows the testing to be decentralized so that results can be quickly obtained in the main hospitals and health centers in the country. Of these, 20 GeneXpert IV machines can do 4 simultaneous tests in 1 hour, and 2 GeneXpert XVI machines can do 16 simultaneous tests in 1 hour.

In Dominican Republic in April 19 new measures regarding health resources were taken. Acquisition of 12 PCR testing machines with 50,000 cartridges, which allows decentralization of testing and that results can be quickly obtained in the main hospitals and health centers in the country. Of these, the 12 FilmArray machines can do 12 simultaneous tests in 1 hour.
Dominican Republic has received 6 kits to detect COVID-19 with a yield of 192 tests each, after April 22.
Dominican Republic has acquired 40 ambulances more to reinforce the 911 system, after April 22
The Dominican Republic announced on April 22 that 40 ambulances would be integrated into 911 in the context of COVID-19.

Dominican Republic has increased rapid testing and PCR capabilities, stablished 24-hour opening of the entire network of primary care services, provision of hospital beds and intensive care during 7 days in the city of Puerto Plata after the massive concentration of people, after April 28

description:
In Dominican Republic, on May 14. Health Risk Administrators (ARS) are required to authorize coverage and payments to Health Service Providers of any excess expenses in intensive care for procedures and medications included in the Basic Health Plan catalog, incurred by affiliates to Family Health Insurance and Special Plans for Pensioners and Retired people.

Likewise, the ARS will cover the days of hospitalization that after intensive care are necessary for the recovery of these patients affected by COVID-19.
Dominican Republic will participate in WHO Solidarity Clinical Trial to help COVID-19 research .
In Dominican Republic the National Health System (SNS) will provide with more health resources since all resident doctors will be incentivated with 10,000 pesos.

Wearing masks is obligatory in public places and private spaces for collective use as a measure to control the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19) in the country.  The non-compliance will carry fines ranging from one to ten minimum rates with people who do not wear masks. From June 22.
type_text: The Dominican Public Health Ministry has stated the obligatory use of masks for all citizens in public spaces and in workplaces, after April 16.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description:
In Dominican Republic on July 15. Health resources have been developed. 
Announcement of an increase in the fees for specialist doctors who care for patients with COVID-19 in hospitalization and Intensive Care, adding Pediatricians and Obstetricians to those previously included.
The contribution for Personal Protective Equipment will also be increased to an estimated total of RD $ 247 million per month, of which the ARS will contribute RD $ 143 million pesos per month and the rest will be covered by the Social Security System and the Government

In Dominican Republic on July 15. Health resources have been developed. 
Announcement of an increase in the fees for specialist doctors who care for patients with COVID-19 in hospitalization and Intensive Care, adding Pediatricians and Obstetricians to those previously included.
The contribution for Personal Protective Equipment will also be increased to an estimated total of RD $ 247 million per month, of which the ARS will contribute RD $ 143 million pesos per month and the rest will be covered by the Social Security System and the Government
The Dominican Republic announced the authorization of an additional 582 hospital beds for COVID-19 patients.

In Dominican Republic more resources in health testing have been deeloped from July 15.
A molecular biology laboratory with the capacity to carry out up to 2,000 daily tests will start operating.
Also announced is the purchase of 100,000 Abbott antibody tests, which have high sensitivity and specificity.

A molecular biology laboratory with the capacity to carry out up to 2,000 daily tests will start operating.
Also announced is the purchase of 100,000 Abbott antibody tests, which have high sensitivity and specificity.
type_sub_cat: Public Testing Facilities (e.g. drive-in testing for COVID-19)

description: In Dominican Republic,on July 15, the provision of 582 beds for COVID-19 patients is announced, of which 395 will be hospitalization and 187 for additional Intensive Care Units, to care for critical patients in the public system.

In Dominican Republic in March 25 new measures regarding health testing. Free tests are provided in private, duly certified laboratories, and in the National Laboratory, for all citizens who present symptoms and / or have been in contact with people who tested positive and have a medical prescription. All the Health Risk Administrators (ARS) have updated their operating platforms to perform tests on both affiliates and non-affiliates.

In Dominican Republic in March 25 new measures regarding health testing  were taken. Free tests are provided in private, duly certified laboratories, and in the National Laboratory, for all citizens who present symptoms and / or have been in contact with people who tested positive and have a medical prescription. All the Health Risk Administrators (ARS) have updated their operating platforms to perform tests on both affiliates and non-affiliates.

In Dominican Republic, in Arpil 5 new measures related to health testing were taken. By Resolution No. 229-2020, the PCR tests for confirmation of the COVID-19 are covered by the ARS (health risk managers) for all persons affiliated or not to Social Security, as well as copays for hospitalization in hospital isolation.

In Dominican Republic in April 13 new measures regarding health testing were taken. It is established that the Health Risk Administrators (ARS) will return to affiliates the total of the rate agreed between the Ministry of Public Health and private laboratories. The reimbursement applies to citizens who have paid for the test between March 18, the date of the signing of the agreement between the Ministry of Public Health and the authorized laboratories, until March 31, when the SISALRIL Resolution that authorizes the test coverage came into force.  It may even cover later dates if the ARS was unable to provide coverage for operational reasons.
In Dominican Republic, two mobile laboratories has been placed to test 2000 people in the city of San Francisco de Macorís, after April 21
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description:
In Dominican Republic new measures regarding health testing have been stablished form March 23.
2 private laboratories have been authorized to carry out virus detection tests.
Until now, it is only recommended to carry it out in the following cases, and provided that you have the proper medical prescription:
-People who have been in countries with circulation of the virus in the last 15 days or who have traveled on cruise ships.
-People who have two or more symptoms associated with the virus.
-People who have been in contact with other people infected by the virus.
Dominican Republic has stablished desinfection measures in public spaces including hospitals, metro stations, parks, supermarkets, etc.after March 26
type_text: Public disinfection measures in public spaces
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: On March 27, the Dominican Republic launched a disinfection plan for "public spaces, such as hospitals, transport stops, including the subway, the cable car, supermarkets and pedestrian bridges, starting with San Francisco de Macorís, Distrito Nacional and Santo Domingo."
On March 30, "a cleaning and disinfection program is carried out in all the glens and areas with stagnant water" in the Dominican Republic.

In Dominican Republic there have been concrete desinfection measures implemented in the province of Duarte. They decontaminated all the medical centers that treat the COVID-19, supermarkets, shopping malls and other crowded places, after April 19.

In Dominican Republic there have been concrete desinfection measures implemented in the province of Duarte. They decontaminated all the medical centers that treat the COVID-19, supermarkets, shopping malls and other crowded places, after April 19.

In Dominican Republic, the ministry of public health has stablished new hygiene measures of disinfection in three areas of Distritio Nacional (IV, VI and  VII) from May 14.
In Dominican Republic, the ministry of public health has stablished new hygiene measures of disinfection in three areas of Distritio Nacional (IV, VI and  VII) from May 14.

On June 16, the Dominican Republic announced "a vector disinfection and control day... with the different municipalities of Greater Santo Domingo and the CAASD, in order to avoid coinfections of the disease with other complications such as dengue."

description: In Dominican republic, the Ministry of public health on July 7 has informed new measures regarding to measures of hygiene.  Disinfection operations will continue to prevent COVID-19. The Los Guaricanos sector will be operated on Thursday 9, while on Friday 11 it will correspond to Los Tres Brazos. From July 7.

description:
In Dominican Republic, in March 21 the government applied new measures related to internal border restriction. Omsa transportation, Cable Car, Metro and intercity buses were suspended.
Now, in May 20. Omsa, cable car and metro will be operative again with 30% of capacity between 6 am and 6pm.

description: In Dominican Republic in March 17. The National Government exhorted to remain at home and only leave when necessary for food, medical supplies or medical attention, keeping the social distance and taking the correct hygiene measures. The government urge the population as a whole to avoid any displacement that is not necessary.
"The Dominican Government,  [...] announced the creation of a high-level commission to monitor the coronavirus" after Mar. 14

description: On April 22 in the Dominican Republic, "the newly opened Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Cybersecurity and Intelligence Center of the Ministry of Defense (C5i) joins the fight against COVID-19. This center will gather in one place all the data from the hospitals, clinics, laboratories, pharmacies and insurance of the Dominican Republic..."

description: In Dominican Republic on March 19 new measures regarding public awarness are taken. Regular press conferences by the Minister of the Presidency and coordinator of the High-Level Commission Against Coronavirus begin to take place on the main measures taken by the government to confront the coronavirus.

description: In Dominican Republic, on March 13 new measures regarding public awarness are taken. The assistance line * 462 is launched, which operates 24 hours a day, informing about the disease, prevention and care measures, specialized centers, how to request tests, etc.

description: Dominican Republic is carrying out an awareness campaing regading hygienic measures such as washing hands with soap and alcohol-based desinfectant, March 27

In Dominican Republic, the curfew was stablished again on 20 of July to last until August 8, it has been extended to September 3.

description: In Dominican Repiblic, in March 17. Non-essential commercial activities were suspended with the exception of those that are dedicated to basic activities for the population: supermarkets, grocery stores, fuel stations, pharmacies and commercial establishments dedicated to the sale of raw or cooked food, like restaurants that will only be operative for delivery and take away services.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is closed/locked down

description:
In Dominican Republic there have been stablished new regulations and restrictions regarding businesses from March 23. 
The closing of face-to-face operations is instructed to non-governmental entities that offer non-essential public services, such as the Chambers of Commerce and Production. They are encouraged to work virtually.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is closed/locked down

description:
In Dominican Republic on May 17 as part of the de-escalation, new measures have been taken regarding restriction of businesses. 

The obligation of different schedules is announced, at 7 AM supermarkets, pharmacies, construction sector, industry and processing companies will begin to operate, including export processing zones. Likewise, mining and quarrying, agricultural and agroindustrial activity and activity in ports and airports will begin at that time, and they will continue to receive only freight and ferry flights.

At 8 AM, public sector employees will begin to work and at 9 AM other businesses such as hardware stores, vehicle dealers, workshops, financial sector, furniture and appliance stores, fabric and clothing stores, in addition to the service sector, would begin operating.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

description: In Dominican Repiblic, in March 17. Non-essential commercial activities were suspended with the exception of those that are dedicated to basic activities for the population: supermarkets, grocery stores, fuel stations, pharmacies and commercial establishments dedicated to the sale of raw or cooked food, like restaurants that will only be operative for delivery and take away services.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is closed/locked down

description: In the Dominican Republic, "The government and the Association of Hotels and Tourism of the Dominican Republic (ASONAHORES) announced this Wednesday the approval of the health protocol to be applied in the tourism sector and ratified the reopening of its operations from July 1."
institution_status: This type of business  ("Other Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
In Dominican Republic it has been stablished new measures regarding restriction and regulation of government services since March 23.
For public offices, 3 categories are established according to the priority of their activity:
- First category must completely close its doors to the public.
- Second category, they will work with the minimum of personnel and they will be able to answer queries by remote means using telework.
(Both cases, they must maintain a minimum staff necessary for basic administrative, financial and operational procedures, as well as security personnel who guarantee the integrity of the facilities)
- Third category (essential activities) will remain with normal activity
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service provided by the government is provided with conditions atttached

description: In Dominican Republic, in March 17, measures regarding mass gathering were stablished. The holding of events and gatherings of all kinds is suspended, which includes public shows, cultural, artistic and sporting events, activities in bars and clubs, proselytizing events, government inaugurations, etc.
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of a recreational or commercial event

description: In Dominican Republic, in March 18 the National Government imposedd new measures related to mass gatherings. The government stated that funeral services and burials are maintained, but assistance is limited only to the immediate family of the deceased.
type_sub_cat: Attendance at religious services restricted (e.g. mosque/church closings)

description:
In Dominican Republic new measures regarding restriction and regulation of government services were taken since March 23.
In April 24 Ministers, directors and general administrators were summoned to join the official work from April 27, this with the minimum personnel and complying with the protocol established by the World Health Organization (WHO), the Pan American Health Organization ( PAHO) and the Ministry of Public Health regarding hygiene, social distancing and protection measures for those who go to work.

In Dominican Republic it has been stablished new measures regarding restriction and regulation of government services since May 17.
The public sector will begin to work with 50% of the personnel, and the incumbents are authorized to increase this percentage if the needs so demand.

In Dominican Republic, now in May 17. Mesaures regarding restriction of businesses had changed, The President of the Republic Danilo Medina announces as part of the de-escalation measures that micro-companies, which may have up to 10 employees, may work up to 5 employees or no more than 50% of the staff.
In the small ones, which are those between 10 and 50, a minimum of 10 people and no more than 50% of their employees may work. Medium and large companies must operate with a maximum of 25% of the staff in the first phase.

In Dominican Republic on May 25, changes in restriction to businesses  have occured. The opening of stores in shopping centers is authorized under strict compliance with general and sectoral protocols, which include hygiene and distance measures, in addition to the maximum number of workers allowed in this first phase of de-escalation.

This decision is made with the purpose of facilitating the purchase of gifts for Mother's Day, as well as other items during the days of the week, avoiding a crowd of customers on Saturdays and Sundays.

Food, games and recreation facilities are kept closed to avoid crowds.
The Domincan Republic imposes public employees over the age of 60 to remain in their homes after Mar. 18

"The Dominican authorities announced further measures to contain the spread of coronavirus in the country:

   Social gatherings are prohibited in grocery stores (colmados),including the consumption of alcoholic beverages on their premises.
    A reminder to the whole population to observe the lockdown, stay at home and only leave when necessary for food, medical supplies or medical attention.
    Requested that celebrations are postponed, such as: wedding or birthdays and apply hygiene measures when leave their home, washing their hands, clothing and shoes upon returning home.
    When leaving domiciles, only one member of the family should do so and keep to social distancing standards (2 metres away from any other person)." after Mar. 23
Dominican Republic has expanded the opening hours of banks nationwide in order to keep social distancing, after April 25.
Dominican Republic has reinforcing the social distancing of 2m in the street and public places  in the city of Puerto Plata, after April 28
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart

description: The Dominican Republic stablished in 19 March that non-essential comercial activities were suspended, however since May 25 stores and shopping centers can open with the rigth measures of hygiene and social distancing and mass gathering is still prohibited.

The Dominican Republic announced regulations on social distancing. Public transportation will open with modified schedules, with at least 1.5 meters of separation between users and a 60% limited capacity. Social distancing of at least 6.5 feet (2 meters) and the use of face masks in public places are required for the general and traveling public within indoor spaces and in areas where social distancing is not possible. These locations include but are not limited to airport terminals, within indoor and outdoor shopping areas, while using public transportation, when seeking medical attention within a hospital or clinic, among others. Social distancing is also required at the beach, and within pool and jacuzzi areas. The maximum group size allowed is 10 people. The regulations should last until 27 September 2020
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
